content: दोषः [दुष् भावे करणे वा घञ्] {@--1@} ({%a%}) A fault, blame, censure, defect, blemish, weak point; पत्रं नैव यदा करीरविटपे दोषो वसंतस्य किं <ls>Bh. 2. 93</ls>; <ls>Pt. 1. 242</ls>; नात्र कुलपतिर्दोषं ग्रहीष्यति <ls>Ś. 3</ls> ‘will not find fault or take exception’; so पुनरुक्तदोषा <ls>R. 14. 9.</ls> ({%b%}) An error, a mistake. {@--2@} A crime, sin, guilt, offence; जायामदोषामुत संत्यजामि <ls>R. 14. 34</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 205</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 79.</ls> {@--3@} Noxious quality, badness, injurious nature or quality; as in आहारदोष. {@--4@} Harm, evil, danger, injury; बहुदोषा हि शर्वरी <ls>Mk. 1. 58</ls>; को दोषः ‘what harm is there’. {@--5@} Bad or injurious consequence, detrimental effect; तत्किमयमातपदोषः स्यात् <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; अदाता वंशदोषेण कर्मदोषाद्दरिद्रता <ls>Chāṇ. 48</ls>; <ls>Ms. 10. 14.</ls> {@--6@} Morbid affection, disease. {@--7@} Disorder of the three humours of the body, or the three humours when in a disordered state. {@--8@} (In Nyāya &c.) A fault of a definition; ({%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} अव्याप्ति, अतिव्याप्ति and असंभव). {@--9@} (In <ab>Rhet.</ab>) A fault or defect of composition (such as पददोष, पदांशदोष, वाक्यदोष, रसदोष, and अर्थदोष which are defined and illustrated in the 7th Ullāsa of <ls>K. P.</ls>). {@--10@} A calf. {@--11@} Refutation. {@--12@} Evening, dusk; <ab>cf.</ab> दोषा.
दोष, दोषिक, दोषिन् See under दुष्.
